body_content.explanation: the ability to talk, the activity of talking, or a piece of spoken language:
examples: Children usually develop speech in the second year of life.
People who suffer a stroke may experience a loss of speech.
His speech was slurred and I thought he was drunk.
Some expressions are used more in speech than in writing.

body_content.explanation: a set of words spoken in a play:
examples: Do you know the words to Hamlet's famous speech at the beginning of Act III?

body_content.explanation: a formal talk given usually to a large number of people on a special occasion:
examples: I had to give/make a speech at my brother's wedding.
The Governor of New York delivered a rousing speech to the national convention.
He gave the after-dinner speech (= a talk given after a formal evening meal at which a large number of people are present).
Did you hear her acceptance speech at the Oscars ceremony?
